definition: to monopolize/to control/to dominate
alone/independent/single/sole/only
variant of 占[zhan4]
to observe/to divine
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field

sentences.english: Usually the tape drive is reserved for the exclusive use of that application.
sentences.chinese: 通常磁带设备是由一个应用程序独占使用的。

sentences.english: We make sure your business stays ahead of the competition and leads the pack.
sentences.chinese: 我们确保你的业务在竞争中脱颖而出，并独占鳌头。

sentences.english: Cool has ego style, exclusivity of beauty is ecru.
sentences.chinese: 酷有自我风格，独占的丽质本色。

sentences.english: Even in brothels he wanted to monopolize because he had money.
sentences.chinese: 逛暗娼他也想独占，因为他有钱。

sentences.english: Real option has personal and monopolize.
sentences.chinese: 实物期权具有先占性和非独占性。

sentences.english: In the occupied areas everything is in the hands of Japanese imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 在沦陷区，则一切被日本帝国主义所独占。

sentences.english: He had such a pleasant sense of proprietorship in her!
sentences.chinese: 他愉快地觉得他独占了她。

sentences.english: Therefore, the application assumes an exclusive access to the database.
sentences.chinese: 因此，应用程序假设对数据库进行独占访问。

sentences.english: Momopoly is the result of market competition.
sentences.chinese: 垄断，也称独占，它是市场竞争的结果。

sentences.english: She tried to monopolize his time.
Guesses on which cake is likely to go first ...!
sentences.chinese: 大家猜猜看哪个蛋糕可能会独占鳌头呢？

sentences.english: Exclusivity and privacy are key factors .
sentences.chinese: 独占性和隐私是关键因素。

sentences.english: We might say that our products are the very best on the market.
sentences.chinese: 顺便奉告，我方产品在市场上独占鳌头。

sentences.english: To be sure, fake or credentials aren't unique to China.
sentences.chinese: 当然，假文凭或虚报学历的情形并非中国独占。

sentences.english: But knowledge is a kind of social resource, it is unable to be monopolized by enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 但知识也是一种社会资源，是无法被企业独占的。

sentences.english: Patricians tried to set up a political monopoly.

definition: to dominate (a market etc)/to monopolize
to occupy by force/to seize/to dominate
to occupy/to hold
to have/to own/to hold/to occupy/to possess/to account for (a high proportion etc)
to dip a finger (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action/abbr. for 染指於鼎|染指于鼎
to take up (one's time etc)/to occupy (one's attention etc)/to account for (a proportion of sth)
to enjoy market dominance/to monopolize
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to covet/to long for/to lust after
to be on an equal footing
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to partition/to divide up
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
(of property) to change owners/(of sovereignty, political power etc) to change hands
to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
